name: Bailey, Arthur E.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found through SEC EDGAR, OpenSecrets, LinkedIn, or web searches. Common name with no distinguishing public profile tied to Bohemian Grove membership.

name: Barbour, Haley
title: Founding Senior Partner; Former Governor of Mississippi; Former RNC Chairman
notes: Haley Barbour served as the 63rd Governor of Mississippi (2004-2012) and as Chairman of the Republican National Committee (1993-1997). He co-founded the Washington lobbying firm BGR Group in 1991 and has been described as one of Washington's all-time mega-lobbyists.
ngos: Bipartisan Policy Center (Co-Chair, Immigration Task Force); National Assessment Governing Board (Chairman, appointed 2019 by Secretary DeVos)
political_donations: Major Republican donor; served as RNC Finance Chairman 1995-1997; his leadership PAC Haley's PAC raised over $1 million in 2010 cycle; co-founded American Crossroads super PAC; contributed to Republican Governors Association

name: Beim, Robert B.
title: Managing Director
notes: Robert B. Beim began his career in 1970 with Arthur Andersen & Company in San Francisco working in tax and financial planning. He later founded Woodside Asset Management and has served clients in individual wealth management and real estate investment.
ngos: UC Berkeley Foundation (Board of Trustees, elected 1997; Executive Committee member; Chair of Investment Committee)

name: Bowlsby, Robert Addison II
employer: University of Northern Iowa (interim); formerly Big 12 Conference
title: Interim Athletic Director; Former Commissioner, Big 12 Conference
notes: Bob Bowlsby served as the fourth Commissioner of the Big 12 Conference from 2012 to 2022. Prior to that role he was athletic director at the University of Northern Iowa, University of Iowa, and Stanford University. He returned to UNI as Interim Athletic Director in November 2023.
ngos: National Football Foundation (Board member)

name: Brill, John Marty Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found through SEC EDGAR, OpenSecrets, LinkedIn, or web searches specific to this individual.

name: Dapper, Samuel M.
title: Vice President of Operations (Zeevo) / Law-trained professional
notes: Samuel Dapper appears to be based in the Scotts Valley, California area with legal training from the University of Michigan Law School. Limited public profile available; this identity requires further verification.

name: Deeter, Byron
title: Partner
notes: Byron Deeter is a Partner at Bessemer Venture Partners specializing in Cloud, AI, and frontier technology investments. He co-authored Bessemer's 10 Laws of Cloud Computing and served as 2024-2025 Chair of the NVCA Board of Directors. He was previously CEO and founder of Trigo Technologies, which was acquired by IBM.
ngos: National Venture Capital Association (NVCA) - Board Chair 2024-2025; ServiceTitan Board Member

name: Dickenson, Charles H.
title: Attorney
notes: Charles Howard Dickenson is an attorney licensed in California since 1978, based in Napa and a partner at the law firm Dickenson Peatman & Fogarty. He practices personal injury and general litigation.

name: Dodd, William H.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found for this specific individual distinct from California State Senator Bill Dodd (William Harold Dodd, D) who served the 3rd Senate district. If this is the same person, he was a successful water quality business owner before entering politics.

name: Downer, E. Michael
title: Vice Chairman of the Board
notes: E. Michael 'Eddie' Downer is the great-grandson of the founder of Mechanics Bank in Richmond, California. He served as President of the bank from 1971 to 1981, as Chairman of the Board from 1981 to 2010, then as Chairman Emeritus before retiring from the board in December 2013. He was Vice Chairman until his retirement.
ngos: National Association of Corporate Directors (Member); Richmond Boys Club; East Bay Region United States Peace Corps; Contra Costa Regional Health Foundation

name: Fulstone, Steven A.
title: Rancher (sixth-generation)
notes: Steven Fulstone is a sixth-generation rancher operating in Smith Valley, Nevada. The Fulstone family has worked the land and raised livestock in Nevada since 1856. Steven participated in a pilot program to reduce groundwater pumping in Smith Valley.

name: Goode, John G.
title: Executive
notes: John G. Goode is associated with Davis Skaggs Investment Management in San Francisco. Limited public profile for this specific individual.

name: Goodin, Robert Allan
employer: Law Offices of Robert A. Goodin
title: Attorney (Solo Practice)
notes: Robert Allan Goodin is a top-rated business litigation attorney in San Francisco practicing securities, antitrust, and general litigation. He earned his JD from UC School of Law in 1974 and his BA from Harvard in 1968. He has been selected to Super Lawyers every year from 2004 to 2025.
ngos: Bay Area Legal Aid (Board of Directors); American College of Trial Lawyers (Fellow); American Law Institute (Member); American Bar Foundation (Fellow)

name: Gsell, Gordon B. Jr.
title: Director
notes: Gordon B. Gsell Jr. directs the Gsell Family Foundation, a Houston-based private foundation focused on health-related funding across several U.S. states. He serves in a minimal capacity with no reported compensation.
ngos: Gsell Family Foundation (Director)

name: Hackbarth, Alfred E. III
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Alfred E. Hackbarth III is Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Thane Partners, a multifamily real estate investment firm. He has over 25 years of experience in real estate, having held senior positions at Cushman & Wakefield and SRS Real Estate Partners.

name: Hardwick, Robert D.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found for this specific individual. Multiple people named Robert Hardwick exist in California, including a wealth advisor and a structural engineer, but none confirmed as matching this Bohemian Grove member.

name: Imrie, Kent S.
employer: Malloy Imrie & Vasconi Insurance Services LLC
title: Owner / Managing Member
notes: Kent Imrie is the owner of MIV Insurance (Malloy Imrie & Vasconi Insurance Services LLC) with offices in Napa, California, and Reno, Nevada. He is a managing member of the company and operates in both the California wine country and Nevada markets.

name: Irwin, John N. III
employer: Hillside Capital Incorporated / Brookside Capital Partners
title: Managing Director
notes: John N. Irwin III has been Managing Director of Hillside Capital Incorporated since 1979. He co-founded The Brookside Group in 1977 and was a pioneer in leveraged buyouts starting in 1970. His maternal grandfather was Thomas Watson, founder of IBM. His father John N. Irwin II served as U.S. Ambassador to France (1973-1974).
ngos: Achelis & Bodman Foundation (Chairman); Watson Foundation (Chairman); Wildlife Conservation Society (Trustee); Fresh Air Fund (Trustee); Princeton Institute for International and Regional Studies (Advisory Council); Teachers College, Columbia University (Vice Chair of Trustees)

name: Kingsley, Daniel R.
title: Chairman
notes: Dan Kingsley is the Chairman of the San Francisco Recovery Fund. Limited additional public profile for this specific individual beyond his San Francisco finance and investment activities.
ngos: San Francisco Recovery Fund (Chairman)

name: Leach, Howard A. (Alec)
employer: Leach Capital Corporation / Foley Timber and Land Company
title: President / CEO
notes: Howard H. Leach (born June 19, 1930) is an American businessman and Republican diplomat who served as U.S. Ambassador to France (2001-2005) under President George W. Bush, for whom he was a major fundraiser ('Pioneer'). He served as Finance Chairman of the Republican National Committee (1995-1997). He is CEO of Leach Capital Corp. and president of Foley Timber and Land Co. (Florida) and co-founded Leach McMicking & Company in San Francisco.
ngos: Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) - Advisory Board; Digital Diagnostics - Board Member; Palm Beach Civic Association; University of California Regents (former member and past chairman)
political_donations: Major Republican donor; contributed $225,559 to GOP in 1999-2000 cycle including $190,300 soft money; $100,000 to Bush-Cheney Inaugural Committee; $25,000 to Republican Governors Association; $100,000 to Governor Ron DeSantis (2018); contributed over $500,000 in 2018 cycle and $577,286 in 2022 cycle, nearly all to Republican causes

name: Leach, Howard H.
employer: Leach Capital Corporation / Foley Timber and Land Company
title: President / CEO
notes: This entry appears to duplicate Howard H. Leach (Howard Alec Leach) listed above. Both 'Howard A. (Alec) Leach' and 'Howard H. Leach' in the Hermits camp list likely refer to the same person: Howard H. Leach, U.S. Ambassador to France (2001-2005), with 'Alec' being a nickname. See entry for Leach, Howard A. for full details.
ngos: See entry for Leach, Howard A.
political_donations: See entry for Leach, Howard A.

name: Lowrey, Charles F. Jr.
title: Executive Chairman; Former Chairman and CEO
notes: Charles F. Lowrey Jr. served as CEO of Prudential Financial from December 2018 to March 2025 and as Chairman from April 2019 to March 2025, now serving as Executive Chairman. Before joining Prudential in 2001 he was a Managing Director at J.P. Morgan. He holds an MBA from Harvard, an M.Arch from Yale, and a B.Arch from Princeton.
ngos: New Jersey Performing Arts Center (Board of Directors; Co-Chair since 2023); New Jersey CEO Council (Co-Chair); LeapFrog Investments (Leadership Council, 2025); Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (Board, elected 2025); Geneva Association (Board); New Jersey Restart and Recovery Commission (appointed by Governor Murphy, 2020)
political_donations: Prudential Financial Federal PAC active; no specific personal donation records found in public databases

name: McEfee, Camden S.
title: Managing Partner
notes: Camden S. McEfee is a founding member of California Strategies LLC, one of California's leading public affairs and lobbying firms, having joined in 1999 and serving as Managing Partner. He previously served as Chief Deputy Cabinet Secretary to Governor Pete Wilson and advised Arnold Schwarzenegger's Proposition 49 (After School Education & Safety Act, 2002).

name: McMicking, Henry C.
title: Partner / Investor
notes: Henry C. McMicking is associated with Leach McMicking & Company, a San Francisco investment firm co-founded with Ambassador Howard Leach. The McMicking family is prominent in San Francisco venture capital; Henry A. McMicking (an earlier generation) helped form one of the first venture capital firms in California and funded Ampex Corporation.
ngos: Joseph & Mercedes McMicking Foundation (family philanthropy)

name: Muller, Brian David
title: President
notes: Brian Muller is President of Harrigan Weidenmuller Company, San Francisco's oldest real estate firm (established 1900), specializing in commercial property management, investment, development, and leasing in the greater San Francisco Bay Area. He joined the firm in 1993 and holds a BS from UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business.
ngos: BOMA San Francisco (active member); Urban Land Institute (active member)

name: Muller, Timothy Matthew
title: President (long-tenured)
notes: Timothy Matthew Muller has been with Harrigan Weidenmuller Company in San Francisco for over forty years and has served as president. The firm manages over 2 million square feet of commercial real estate across diverse property types in the greater San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Schadlich, Scott F.
title: President
notes: Scott F. Schadlich is President of Next Investments, Inc., a Healdsburg, California real estate company that acquires and manages commercial properties (industrial, office, and retail) in Marin, Sonoma, and Mendocino counties. He has over 25 years of experience in real estate and business management.
ngos: Sonoma Country Day School (Board of Trustees; Chair of Board, joined 2014)

name: Schultz, Gregory W.
employer: The Staubach Company (formerly) / First American Title Insurance
title: Senior Vice President and Regional Manager
notes: Gregory W. Schultz served as Senior Vice President and Regional Manager with The Staubach Company in Los Angeles and spent twelve years with Metropolitan Structures West, Inc. as Senior Vice President responsible for the California Plaza Project in downtown Los Angeles. He is a member of the USC Lusk Center for Real Estate.

name: Streblow, Jeff
title: Senior Vice President / Chief Transformation Officer
notes: Jeff Streblow has been with Wilbur-Ellis Company since 1983 and serves as SVP/Chief Transformation Officer at Connell, a division responsible for specialty chemical and ingredients distribution throughout Asia Pacific with 50 offices in 17 countries. He is a Napa native whose family has deep ties to the Queen of the Valley Medical Center.
ngos: Queen of the Valley Foundation (Board of Trustees)

name: Swanson, W. Clarke
title: Founder; Former CEO
notes: W. Clarke Swanson Jr. founded Swanson Vineyards in Oakville, Napa Valley in 1985, previously known for handcrafted Pinot Grigio, Merlot, and Alexis Cabernet Sauvignon. He built a career in banking, radio, cable TV, and community newspapers in Florida, and was majority owner and CEO of Napa National Bancorp. He holds a BA from Stanford and MS in Journalism from Columbia. The vineyard was acquired by Vintage Wine Estates in 2015.
ngos: Festival Napa Valley (Board of Directors; Chair of Audit Committee, joined 2013); W. Clarke Swanson Jr. Foundation (private foundation)

name: Chiles, John G.
title: Senior Managing Director (retired); Lead Director and Strategic Advisor
notes: John G. Chiles is based in Piedmont, California. He was a senior member of the Jefferies Financial Sponsors Group and retired from Jefferies at the end of 2010. Post-retirement, his primary business focus has been as Lead Director and strategic advisor for BirchStreet Systems, Inc. He holds a BA in Economics and Political Science from UC Santa Barbara and an MBA from University of San Francisco.
ngos: Auksucai Foundation, Davis, California (listed member)

name: Colt, R. Ken
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found for R. Ken Colt through SEC EDGAR, OpenSecrets, LinkedIn, or general web searches.

name: Crutcher, Mark James Jr.
title: President and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Mark J. Crutcher Jr. is President and CEO of Landscape Development, Inc. (LDI), California's industry-leading integrated landscape services company. He joined LDI in 2016 as COO, growing revenue from approximately $50 million to $143 million by 2022. He previously spent ten years as Vice President at Valley Crest Companies. He holds a BA and MBA from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo and completed an Advanced Management Program at Wharton.

name: Davis, Wade
title: Professor of Anthropology; BC Leadership Chair in Cultures and Ecosystems at Risk
notes: Edmund Wade Davis is a Canadian cultural anthropologist, ethnobotanist, photographer, and author. He served as Explorer-in-Residence at the National Geographic Society (2000-2013) and is currently a professor at UBC. He is best known for his 1985 book The Serpent and the Rainbow. His 2012 book Into the Silence won the Baillie Gifford Prize for non-fiction. He holds degrees from Harvard in anthropology, biology, and a PhD in ethnobotany.
ngos: National Geographic Society (NGS Explorers Council); Voices for Biodiversity (Advisory Board); Cultural Sanctuaries Foundation (associated); International League of Conservation Photographers (Fellow); Explorers Club (Honorary Member); Royal Canadian Geographical Society (Honorary Vice-President)

name: Empey, Gordon Hume
title: Chief Operating Officer and Partner / General Counsel
notes: Gordon Empey was appointed COO of Frazier Life Sciences in May 2025, having served as Partner and General Counsel since 2017. He brings over 25 years of experience advising venture capital investors and life sciences companies. Before FLS he was a partner at Cooley LLP and previously EVP and General Counsel at Radiant Research. He holds a JD from UC Berkeley School of Law (1994) and BA in History from Colgate University (1990).

name: Empey, Morgan H.
title: Account Director
notes: Morgan H. Empey is an Account Director at Salesforce based in Irvine, California. He is educated at the University of California, Berkeley. He previously held roles at Oracle, VectorUSA, and Navisite. Likely related to Gordon Empey (same Rendezvous camp).

name: Fama, Glenn J.
employer: Fama & Co. Capital Wealth Management (Wells Fargo Advisors Financial Network)
title: Chairman, Managing Director, and Principal
notes: Glenn J. Fama founded Fama & Co. Capital Wealth Management in early 2008, a boutique investment advisory firm on Montgomery Street in San Francisco affiliated with Wells Fargo Advisors Financial Network. He has over 35 years of investment advisory experience, having previously held senior positions at Paine Webber (1986-1996), First Union (1996-2000), and UBS (2000-2007). He holds a BS in Finance from the University of Nevada.

name: Gregory, David
employer: CNN; American University School of International Service
title: Political Analyst (CNN); Adjunct Professor
notes: David Michael Gregory is an American television journalist who hosted NBC's Meet the Press from December 2008 to August 2014 (succeeding Tim Russert). He previously served as NBC's Chief White House Correspondent during the George W. Bush presidency. He joined CNN as a political analyst in March 2016 and teaches at American University's School of International Service.
ngos: Milwaukee Jewish Federation (speaker/supporter); Vail Symposium (speaker)

name: Haller, Thomas F. Jr.

name: Harwood, Edward S.
title: Unknown

Harwood (1900-1980) was a prominent libertarian economist who founded the American Institute for Economic Research (AIER) and died in Montecito, California, but lived prior to this era.

name: Herrick, Jerome Neal
title: Unknown
notes: Jerome Neal Herrick is listed as a resident of Piedmont, California (age mid-70s). He has been associated with K.S.D. Atlantic Transport Systems and Meran Technology. Limited public profile available.

name: Lerude, Warren Leslie
title: Professor Emeritus, Reynolds School of Journalism
notes: Warren Leslie Lerude (born October 29, 1937) is a Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist and professor emeritus at UNR's Reynolds School of Journalism. He shared the 1977 Pulitzer Prize for editorial writing for a series of editorials against brothel owner Joe Conforte of the Mustang Ranch. He served as publisher of both the Reno Evening Gazette and Nevada State Journal under Gannett, and taught at UNR from 1981 until retirement in 2009. He served as a Pulitzer juror seven times.
ngos: Nevada Press Association (Hall of Fame inductee)

name: Littlefield, Edmund W. Jr.
employer: Sage Foundation / Edmund & Jeannik Littlefield Foundation
title: Director / Vice President
notes: Edmund W. Littlefield Jr. is a philanthropist and musician who directs the Sage Foundation (Arlington, WA, assets $53.8M). He is Vice President of the Edmund & Jeannik Littlefield Foundation (established 1958, California). His father Edmund Wattis Littlefield (1914-2001) was the CEO of Utah Construction & Mining Co. who oversaw its 1976 merger with General Electric, the largest corporate merger in U.S. history at that time, creating Utah International.
ngos: Sage Foundation (Director); Edmund & Jeannik Littlefield Foundation (Vice President); Fort Worden PDA (major donor, $4 million gift)

name: Lovewell, John Brownlee
title: Founder and President
notes: John Brownlee Lovewell founded The Lovewell Company in September 1987, a Silicon Valley commercial real estate development firm investing in speculative office, R&D, and retail projects. He previously was a general partner at Mozart Development Company in Palo Alto (1982-1987) and served as VP/President of Argus Financial Corporation. He graduated from UC Berkeley and earned his MBA from San Francisco State University. He resides in Atherton, California.
ngos: Institute of World Politics (Chairman of the Board, elected 2019; Board member for 14+ years; Vice Chairman for many years)

name: Marks, Robert Thomas
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found for Robert Thomas Marks matching this Bohemian Grove member. Multiple Robert Marks exist in California but none confirmed as matching this profile.

name: McCabe, Charles K.
title: Chief Advisor
notes: Charles K. McCabe is the great-grandson of E.W. Scripps, who founded the Scripps-Howard newspaper chain and United Press wire service. McCabe established the Manifold Fund in 2018 to follow in the Scripps family tradition of scientific philanthropy and currently serves as Chief Advisor. Note: the famous San Francisco Chronicle columnist Charles McCabe (1915-1983) is a different person.
ngos: Society for Science (affiliated); Manifold Fund (founder/chief advisor)

name: Merten, John R.
title: Chief Executive Officer
notes: John Merten is CEO of Studio Green, a company based in San Anselmo, California. He previously was a Partner at Barclays Private Equity. He holds an architecture degree from California Polytechnic State University.

name: Merten, Peter B.
title: Unknown
notes: No confirmed biographical information found for Peter B. Merten. Likely related to John R. Merten (same camp). Limited public profile available.

name: Morrish, William B.
employer: Parsons School of Design (formerly) / Invested Public Network
title: Urban Designer; Professor Emeritus
notes: William B. Morrish is an architect and urban planner recognized by the New York Times in 1994 as 'the most valuable thinker in urbanism today.' He is a graduate of UC Berkeley and the Harvard Graduate School of Design. His work focuses on infrastructure as cultural landscape and affordable housing development. He has written for Places Journal and published books on urban habitats.
ngos: Charlottesville Community Design Center (collaborator)

name: Mott, Brian T.
title: President and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Brian Mott founded Langtech Systems Consulting in 1987 in San Francisco with a mission to help organizations strengthen their competitive edge through technology solutions. His career began at Oracle Corporation developing large-scale manufacturing and control systems. He holds an MBA in Information Technology from UCLA.

name: Phipps, Allen M.
title: Owner / Principal; Former CEO
notes: Allen M. Phipps is a management consultant based in Menlo Park, California. He is a former CEO of SRI Consulting and a former Partner at The Boston Consulting Group. He is a nationally recognized keynote speaker and author of 25 publications and 5 books specializing in strategic business models. He is a graduate of Stanford University Graduate School of Business.

name: Saffir, Richard A.
title: Chief Legal Officer
notes: Richard A. Saffir is a San Francisco-based attorney and technology executive. He currently serves as Chief Legal Officer at Kavia AI. His career has spanned multiple tech/telecom companies including PeakNet, PT Holding Company, Odyssey Telecorp, Osprey Management & Capital, and Wurl. He is a licensed California attorney (Bar #133899) holding an LLM in Tax Law from New York University.

name: Stenovec, P. Andrew
title: Executive Vice President, Capital Markets
notes: P. Andrew 'Andy' Stenovec is Executive Vice President of Capital Markets at Griffis Residential, overseeing capital raising and client servicing for the firm that manages over $2 billion in assets. He was previously West Coast regional team leader for GMO's Global Client Relations team, co-founder and managing member of RBI Capital Management, and Executive Vice President/Co-Head of North American Client Relations at Capital Guardian Trust Company (Capital Group). He holds a BA from Colorado College and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
